title: Croque Madame Sandwiches | Everyday Food with Sarah Carey
description:
I know, I know, a Croque Madame is usually served for brunch, but trust me, it makes a delicious weeknight dinner too. Just think of it as a jacked-up grilled cheese -- who doesn't love that? Oh, and did I mention it's done in 20 minutes? Now we're talking!
Round up some butter, sandwich bread, melt-y cheese such as Gruyere, deli ham, and eggs, and you're ready to get started. 

Sarah's Tip of the Day: 
Watch the video to see how to get your bread all brown and toasty in the oven -- no stovetop frying necessary! Plus, check out my favorite way to cook a sunny-side-up egg. 

Subscribe for more easy and delicious recipes: http://full.sc/P8YgBt

---------------------------------------------------------------

Recipe Ingredients:
1/4 cup (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature
16 slices thin white sandwich bread
1/4 pound Gruyere cheese, thinly sliced
1/2 pound thinly sliced deli ham
Coarse salt and ground pepper
8 large eggs

Get the Full Recipe:
http://www.marthastewart.com/349728/croque-madame-sandwiches

Nutritional Info: 
per serv (makes 8): 333 cal; 19 g fat (9 g sat fat); 18 g protein; 22 g carb; 1 g fiber

More Sandwich Recipes: http://full.sc/PSeFrN

Sarah Carey is the editor of Everyday Food magazine and her job is to come up with the best ways to make fast, delicious food at home. But she's also a mom to two hungry kids, so the question "What's for dinner?" is never far from her mind -- or theirs, it seems! Her days can get crazy busy (whose don't?), so these videos are all about her favorite fast, fresh meals -- and the tricks she uses to make it all SO much easier.
